title: Update and fix
body:
Buildkite introduced the "FAILING" state for builds when a job has failed, but there are still other jobs running. This broke the queries used to acquire the currently running builds, which would cause any job that had not been scheduled before another job failed to never start since jobify would not see the build any longer and would never spin up a k8s job, effectively permanently hanging builds since buildkite still has no way to specify timeouts when waiting for an agent https://forum.buildkite.community/t/timeout-waiting-for-agent/188/3

- Update buildkite schema to latest
- Update dependencies
- Cleanup lints
- Cleanup
- Update to clap 3
- Cleanup output
- Nuke unused gql stuff
- Fix queries
- Simplify container building

title: Fixup
body:
- Update deps
- Fix clippy lints
- Update docker image
- Update CHANGELOG

title: Replace pipeline slugs with ids
body: Rather than doing multiple queries for both the organization, as well as finding pipelines by their slug/name, instead we just expect the user to directly specify the pipeline IDs they wish to monitor for builds which is easily discoverable in the pipeline's settings page. This removes the need to specify the organization since pipeline ids are globally unique, and means we don't have to query for pipelines, just the exact one we want.

title: Multi jobify
body:
Add support for specifying a `cluster` key on both the jobify instance and in the agent config so that agents are only spawned on the cluster the jobifier is paired with. This was a much easier option than trying to support multiple clusters from the same jobify instance.

Also fixes all the clippy lints in v3.

Resolves: #5 
Resolves: #25

title: Backoff when buildkite queries fail, but never stop querying
Use pipeline slugs instead of names
Update base image, print more verbose errors
Update Rust CI
body: This brings the Rust CI up to date with the opensource-template

title: Add support for discord channel
body: Added support for discord channel in contribution guidelines :)

title: Add project maintainers as codeowners
body: We are making our open source project maintainers explicit with a CODEOWNERS file. Let me know if these are not the correct maintainers for this project

body: The current URL points to the old website and is invalid
